00030 #include <lustre_quota.h>
00031 #include <obd.h>
00032 #include "osd_internal.h"
00033 
00037 uint64_t osd_quota_fid2dmu(const struct lu_fid *fid)
00038 {
00039         LASSERT(fid_is_acct(fid));
00040         if (fid_oid(fid) == ACCT_GROUP_OID)
00041                 return DMU_GROUPUSED_OBJECT;
00042         return DMU_USERUSED_OBJECT;
00043 }
00044 
00049 static uint64_t osd_objset_user_iused(struct osd_device *osd, uint64_t uidbytes)
00050 {
00051         uint64_t refdbytes, availbytes, usedobjs, availobjs;
00052         uint64_t uidobjs, bshift;
00053 
00054         /* get fresh statfs info */
00055         dmu_objset_space(osd->od_os, &refdbytes, &availbytes,
00056                          &usedobjs, &availobjs);
00057 
00058         /* estimate the number of objects based on the disk usage */
00059         bshift = fls64(osd->od_max_blksz) - 1;
00060         uidobjs = osd_objs_count_estimate(refdbytes, usedobjs,
00061                                           uidbytes >> bshift, bshift);
00062         if (uidbytes > 0)
00063                 /* if we have at least 1 byte, we have at least one dnode ... */
00064                 uidobjs = max_t(uint64_t, uidobjs, 1);
00065 
00066         return uidobjs;
00067 }
00068 
00088 static int osd_acct_index_lookup(const struct lu_env *env,
00089                                 struct dt_object *dtobj,
00090                                 struct dt_rec *dtrec,
00091                                 const struct dt_key *dtkey)
00092 {
00093         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00094         char                    *buf  = info->oti_buf;
00095         struct lquota_acct_rec  *rec  = (struct lquota_acct_rec *)dtrec;
00096         struct osd_object       *obj = osd_dt_obj(dtobj);
00097         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00098         int                      rc;
00099         uint64_t                 oid;
00100         ENTRY;
00101 
00102         rec->bspace = rec->ispace = 0;
00103 
00104         /* convert the 64-bit uid/gid into a string */
00105         sprintf(buf, "%llx", *((__u64 *)dtkey));
00106         /* fetch DMU object ID (DMU_USERUSED_OBJECT/DMU_GROUPUSED_OBJECT) to be
00107          * used */
00108         oid = osd_quota_fid2dmu(lu_object_fid(&dtobj->do_lu));
00109 
00110         /* disk usage (in bytes) is maintained by DMU.
00111          * DMU_USERUSED_OBJECT/DMU_GROUPUSED_OBJECT are special objects which
00112          * not associated with any dmu_but_t (see dnode_special_open()).
00113          * As a consequence, we cannot use udmu_zap_lookup() here since it
00114          * requires a valid oo_db. */
00115         rc = -zap_lookup(osd->od_os, oid, buf, sizeof(uint64_t), 1,
00116                         &rec->bspace);
00117         if (rc == -ENOENT)
00118                 /* user/group has not created anything yet */
00119                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: id %s not found in DMU accounting ZAP\n",
00120                        osd->od_svname, buf);
00121         else if (rc)
00122                 RETURN(rc);
00123 
00124         if (osd->od_quota_iused_est) {
00125                 if (rec->bspace != 0)
00126                         /* estimate #inodes in use */
00127                         rec->ispace = osd_objset_user_iused(osd, rec->bspace);
00128                 RETURN(+1);
00129         }
00130 
00131         /* as for inode accounting, it is not maintained by DMU, so we just
00132          * use our own ZAP to track inode usage */
00133         rc = -zap_lookup(osd->od_os, obj->oo_db->db_object,
00134                          buf, sizeof(uint64_t), 1, &rec->ispace);
00135         if (rc == -ENOENT)
00136                 /* user/group has not created any file yet */
00137                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: id %s not found in accounting ZAP\n",
00138                        osd->od_svname, buf);
00139         else if (rc)
00140                 RETURN(rc);
00141 
00142         RETURN(+1);
00143 }
00144 
00151 static struct dt_it *osd_it_acct_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00152                                       struct dt_object *dt,
00153                                       __u32 attr)
00154 {
00155         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00156         struct osd_it_quota     *it;
00157         struct lu_object        *lo   = &dt->do_lu;
00158         struct osd_device       *osd  = osd_dev(lo->lo_dev);
00159         int                      rc;
00160         ENTRY;
00161 
00162         LASSERT(lu_object_exists(lo));
00163 
00164         if (info == NULL)
00165                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00166 
00167         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(it);
00168         if (it == NULL)
00169                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00170 
00171         memset(it, 0, sizeof(*it));
00172         it->oiq_oid = osd_quota_fid2dmu(lu_object_fid(lo));
00173 
00174         /* initialize zap cursor */
00175         rc = osd_zap_cursor_init(&it->oiq_zc, osd->od_os, it->oiq_oid, 0);
00176         if (rc != 0) {
00177                 OBD_FREE_PTR(it);
00178                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00179         }
00180 
00181         /* take object reference */
00182         lu_object_get(lo);
00183         it->oiq_obj   = osd_dt_obj(dt);
00184         it->oiq_reset = 1;
00185 
00186         RETURN((struct dt_it *)it);
00187 }
00188 
00194 static void osd_it_acct_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
00195 {
00196         struct osd_it_quota     *it     = (struct osd_it_quota *)di;
00197         ENTRY;
00198 
00199         osd_zap_cursor_fini(it->oiq_zc);
00200         lu_object_put(env, &it->oiq_obj->oo_dt.do_lu);
00201         OBD_FREE_PTR(it);
00202 
00203         EXIT;
00204 }
00205 
00215 static int osd_it_acct_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
00216 {
00217         struct osd_it_quota     *it = (struct osd_it_quota *)di;
00218         zap_attribute_t         *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00219         int                      rc;
00220         ENTRY;
00221 
00222         if (it->oiq_reset == 0)
00223                 zap_cursor_advance(it->oiq_zc);
00224         it->oiq_reset = 0;
00225         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->oiq_zc, za);
00226         if (rc == -ENOENT) /* reached the end */
00227                 rc = 1;
00228         RETURN(rc);
00229 }
00230 
00236 static struct dt_key *osd_it_acct_key(const struct lu_env *env,
00237                                       const struct dt_it *di)
00238 {
00239         struct osd_it_quota     *it = (struct osd_it_quota *)di;
00240         zap_attribute_t         *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00241         int                      rc;
00242         ENTRY;
00243 
00244         it->oiq_reset = 0;
00245         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->oiq_zc, za);
00246         if (rc)
00247                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00248         rc = kstrtoull(za->za_name, 16, &it->oiq_id);
00249 
00250         RETURN((struct dt_key *) &it->oiq_id);
00251 }
00252 
00258 static int osd_it_acct_key_size(const struct lu_env *env,
00259                                 const struct dt_it *di)
00260 {
00261         ENTRY;
00262         RETURN((int)sizeof(uint64_t));
00263 }
00264 
00265 /*
00266  * zap_cursor_retrieve read from current record.
00267  * to read bytes we need to call zap_lookup explicitly.
00268  */
00269 static int osd_zap_cursor_retrieve_value(const struct lu_env *env,
00270                                          zap_cursor_t *zc,  char *buf,
00271                                          int buf_size, int *bytes_read)
00272 {
00273         zap_attribute_t *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00274         int rc, actual_size;
00275 
00276         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(zc, za);
00277         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
00278                 return -rc;
00279 
00280         if (unlikely(za->za_integer_length <= 0))
00281                 return -ERANGE;
00282 
00283         actual_size = za->za_integer_length * za->za_num_integers;
00284 
00285         if (actual_size > buf_size) {
00286                 actual_size = buf_size;
00287                 buf_size = actual_size / za->za_integer_length;
00288         } else {
00289                 buf_size = za->za_num_integers;
00290         }
00291 
00292         rc = -zap_lookup(zc->zc_objset, zc->zc_zapobj,
00293                          za->za_name, za->za_integer_length,
00294                          buf_size, buf);
00295 
00296         if (likely(rc == 0))
00297                 *bytes_read = actual_size;
00298 
00299         return rc;
00300 }
00301 
00308 static int osd_it_acct_rec(const struct lu_env *env,
00309                            const struct dt_it *di,
00310                            struct dt_rec *dtrec, __u32 attr)
00311 {
00312         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00313         zap_attribute_t         *za = &info->oti_za;
00314         struct osd_it_quota     *it = (struct osd_it_quota *)di;
00315         struct lquota_acct_rec  *rec  = (struct lquota_acct_rec *)dtrec;
00316         struct osd_object       *obj = it->oiq_obj;
00317         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(obj);
00318         int                      bytes_read;
00319         int                      rc;
00320         ENTRY;
00321 
00322         it->oiq_reset = 0;
00323         rec->ispace = rec->bspace = 0;
00324 
00325         /* retrieve block usage from the DMU accounting object */
00326         rc = osd_zap_cursor_retrieve_value(env, it->oiq_zc,
00327                                            (char *)&rec->bspace,
00328                                            sizeof(uint64_t), &bytes_read);
00329         if (rc)
00330                 RETURN(rc);
00331 
00332         if (osd->od_quota_iused_est) {
00333                 if (rec->bspace != 0)
00334                         /* estimate #inodes in use */
00335                         rec->ispace = osd_objset_user_iused(osd, rec->bspace);
00336                 RETURN(0);
00337         }
00338 
00339         /* retrieve key associated with the current cursor */
00340         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->oiq_zc, za);
00341         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
00342                 RETURN(rc);
00343 
00344         /* inode accounting is not maintained by DMU, so we use our own ZAP to
00345          * track inode usage */
00346         rc = -zap_lookup(osd->od_os, it->oiq_obj->oo_db->db_object,
00347                          za->za_name, sizeof(uint64_t), 1, &rec->ispace);
00348         if (rc == -ENOENT)
00349                 /* user/group has not created any file yet */
00350                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: id %s not found in accounting ZAP\n",
00351                        osd->od_svname, za->za_name);
00352         else if (rc)
00353                 RETURN(rc);
00354 
00355         RETURN(0);
00356 }
00357 
00363 static __u64 osd_it_acct_store(const struct lu_env *env,
00364                                const struct dt_it *di)
00365 {
00366         struct osd_it_quota *it = (struct osd_it_quota *)di;
00367         ENTRY;
00368         it->oiq_reset = 0;
00369         RETURN(osd_zap_cursor_serialize(it->oiq_zc));
00370 }
00371 
00383 static int osd_it_acct_load(const struct lu_env *env,
00384                             const struct dt_it *di, __u64 hash)
00385 {
00386         struct osd_it_quota     *it  = (struct osd_it_quota *)di;
00387         struct osd_device       *osd = osd_obj2dev(it->oiq_obj);
00388         zap_attribute_t         *za = &osd_oti_get(env)->oti_za;
00389         zap_cursor_t            *zc;
00390         int                      rc;
00391         ENTRY;
00392 
00393         /* create new cursor pointing to the new hash */
00394         rc = osd_zap_cursor_init(&zc, osd->od_os, it->oiq_oid, hash);
00395         if (rc)
00396                 RETURN(rc);
00397         osd_zap_cursor_fini(it->oiq_zc);
00398         it->oiq_zc = zc;
00399         it->oiq_reset = 0;
00400 
00401         rc = -zap_cursor_retrieve(it->oiq_zc, za);
00402         if (rc == 0)
00403                 rc = 1;
00404         else if (rc == -ENOENT)
00405                 rc = 0;
00406 
00407         RETURN(rc);
00408 }

00421 static int osd_it_acct_get(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di,
00422                 const struct dt_key *key)
00423 {
00424         ENTRY;
00425 
00426         /* XXX: like osd_zap_it_get(), API is currently broken */
00427         LASSERT(*((__u64 *)key) == 0);
00428 
00429         RETURN(osd_it_acct_load(env, di, 0));
00430 }

00437 static void osd_it_acct_put(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_it *di)
00438 {
00439 }

00444 const struct dt_index_operations osd_acct_index_ops = {
00445         .dio_lookup = osd_acct_index_lookup,
00446         .dio_it     = {
00447                 .init           = osd_it_acct_init,
00448                 .fini           = osd_it_acct_fini,
00449                 .get            = osd_it_acct_get,
00450                 .put            = osd_it_acct_put,
00451                 .next           = osd_it_acct_next,
00452                 .key            = osd_it_acct_key,
00453                 .key_size       = osd_it_acct_key_size,
00454                 .rec            = osd_it_acct_rec,
00455                 .store          = osd_it_acct_store,
00456                 .load           = osd_it_acct_load
00457         }
00458 };

00464 /*
00465  * Wrapper for qsd_op_begin().
00466  *
00467  * \param env    - the environment passed by the caller
00468  * \param osd    - is the osd_device
00469  * \param uid    - user id of the inode
00470  * \param gid    - group id of the inode
00471  * \param space  - how many blocks/inodes will be consumed/released
00472  * \param oh     - osd transaction handle
00473  * \param is_blk - block quota or inode quota?
00474  * \param flags  - if the operation is write, return no user quota, no
00475  *                  group quota, or sync commit flags to the caller
00476  * \param force  - set to 1 when changes are performed by root user and thus
00477  *                  can't failed with EDQUOT
00478  *
00479  * \retval 0      - success
00480  * \retval -ve    - failure
00481  */
00482 int osd_declare_quota(const struct lu_env *env, struct osd_device *osd,
00483                       qid_t uid, qid_t gid, long long space,
00484                       struct osd_thandle *oh, bool is_blk, int *flags,
00485                       bool force)
00486 {
00487         struct osd_thread_info  *info = osd_oti_get(env);
00488         struct lquota_id_info   *qi = &info->oti_qi;
00489         struct qsd_instance     *qsd = osd->od_quota_slave;
00490         int                      rcu, rcg; /* user & group rc */
00491         ENTRY;
00492 
00493         if (unlikely(qsd == NULL))
00494                 /* quota slave instance hasn't been allocated yet */
00495                 RETURN(0);
00496 
00497         /* let's start with user quota */
00498         qi->lqi_id.qid_uid = uid;
00499         qi->lqi_type       = USRQUOTA;
00500         qi->lqi_space      = space;
00501         qi->lqi_is_blk     = is_blk;
00502         rcu = qsd_op_begin(env, qsd, &oh->ot_quota_trans, qi, flags);
00503 
00504         if (force && (rcu == -EDQUOT || rcu == -EINPROGRESS))
00505                 /* ignore EDQUOT & EINPROGRESS when changes are done by root */
00506                 rcu = 0;
00507 
00508         /* For non-fatal error, we want to continue to get the noquota flags
00509          * for group id. This is only for commit write, which has @flags passed
00510          * in. See osd_declare_write_commit().
00511          * When force is set to true, we also want to proceed with the gid */
00512         if (rcu && (rcu != -EDQUOT || flags == NULL))
00513                 RETURN(rcu);
00514 
00515         /* and now group quota */
00516         qi->lqi_id.qid_gid = gid;
00517         qi->lqi_type       = GRPQUOTA;
00518         rcg = qsd_op_begin(env, qsd, &oh->ot_quota_trans, qi, flags);
00519 
00520         if (force && (rcg == -EDQUOT || rcg == -EINPROGRESS))
00521                 /* as before, ignore EDQUOT & EINPROGRESS for root */
00522                 rcg = 0;
00523 
00524         RETURN(rcu ? rcu : rcg);
00525 }
